title: Comedian Katherine Ryan left terrified after masked man breaks into her home
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Katherine Ryan has spoken of the terrifying moment when a masked assailant robbed her home, stealing a ring and attempting to steal her laptop.

The Canadian comedian, who has lived in the UK since 2008, was the unfortunate victim of the robbing in her home in the early hours of 20 October.

Her boyfriend managed to fight off the masked man as he attempted to steal Katherine’s laptop, which contained important documents such as the scripts for her Netflix series, Katherine Ryan: Glitter Room.

Katherine shared details of the incident to her Instagram followers, as she first shared a clip of the police inside of her home to her Instagram story, with the song Bad Boys by Inner Circle playing in the background.

‘Cool to be robbed tonight by a masked man in our home,’ she captioned the post.

She later revealed to her followers that her boyfriend was able to get her laptop back from the robber in question, as she said in footage posted to her story: ‘This is why I love Bobby K because he got in a fight and wrestled back my Netflix series and all my scripts.’

However, as she showed her laptop to the camera, she also pointed out at the fact that it now has blood stains on it.

And as a result of the break-in, she later admitted to not being able to get back to sleep, as shared footage of her from her bed at 5:10am.

‘That’s fine I never liked sleeping anyway,’ she joked.

Katherine shared footage of the police in her home (Picture: Instagram)

She revealed that she could not get back to sleep following the incident (Picture: Instagram)

Katherine later sarcastically thanked her fans for the support and their messages, as she later shared screenshots of some of the rude and sexually explicit messages she had been receiving.

‘Thank you this morning for all your messages of support,’ she said.

Unfortunately, Katherine lost a ring to the attacker, with the 36-year-old taking to Twitter to share a photo of the stolen item, asking for it to be circulated around pawn shops.

‘Is there a way to circulate this foreshadowing ring around pawn shops that the masked man stole before he was tackled into the street?’ she asked.
